This restaurant's warm spirit, famous foccacia and award-winning pizzas make it a favorite for locals and visitors alike. Dine al fresco in the fireplace courtyard or in the old wood, glass and stone decorated dining room.

One of Northern California’s largest and most frequented tide pool reserves; contains a fascinating array of 49 different species of sea life, plus an interpretive center. Call for tide information, as low tide is the best time to go.
These gardens are modeled after the Korakuen Gardens in Okayama, Japan, the sister city of San Jose. Rare Koi fish swim in four heart-shaped lakes.

The ultimate place for blues for more than 20 years, JJ’s offers live music nightly by both established and up-and-coming acts.

Owner/chef John Bentley’s menu of delicious, innovative American cuisine features sustainably farmed produce and free range beef; imaginative ideas and personal touches have established this award-winning restaurant as a Peninsula icon.

This gallery showcases furniture made from 100-year-old African hardwood railway ties, plus African artifacts from warthog tusk bottle openers to ceremonial masks and life-size carvings by indigenous tribes.

Master teppan chefs will amaze you at this restaurant popular for its combination of cuisine and showmanship. Choose from a variety of sashimi, sushi, tempura, teriyaki, and house specialties like the filet mignon and lobster.
